body:
I am thirty-three -- the age of the good Sans-culotte Jesus an age fatal to revolutionists.
Advice is seldom welcome and those who want it the most always like it the least.
The facts of a person's life will, like murder, come out.
The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
I never let them cough. They wouldn't dare.
Let us endeavor so to live that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
Better a snotty child than his nose wiped off.
For organizations and employees alike, the only real security is the ability to grow, change and adapt.
No scoundrel is so stupid as to not find a reason for his vile conduct.
I owe my success to having listened respectfully to the very best advice, and then going away and doing the exact opposite.
One of the most striking signs of the decay of art is when we see its separate forms jumbled together.
Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than to polish.
A man cannot be made comfortable without his own approval.
In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
Art, whose honesty must work through artifice, cannot avoid cheating truth.
All things come from above.
It is a mistake to expect good work from expatriates for it is not what they do that matters but what they are not doing.
Drinking is the soldier's pleasure.
